key_mistakes.reason: Black played c6 instead of the more common e5, allowing White to gain a slight advantage.
Black missed the opportunity to develop the bishop and control the center.
White did not develop the knight, missing an opportunity to control the center.
Black played a passive move instead of gaining a stronger position.
White played a defensive move instead of castling.
Black allowed White a significant advantage with an incorrect pawn move.
White weakened their pawn structure and allowed Black to capitalize.
Black exchanged pieces but missed a chance to improve their position with a better move.
Black missed an opportunity to create a stronger attack.
Black missed the chance to create pressure on White's position.
Black played a passive move instead of creating threats.
Black missed a chance to maintain pressure on White.
Black lost the advantage with a poor queen move.
Black's queen move was less effective, losing tempo.
Black retreated unnecessarily, weakening their position.
Black's queen move allowed White to regain the initiative.
Black blundered the opportunity to create threats.
Black missed an opportunity to put pressure on White's position.

recommendations: Improve your understanding of pawn structures to better control the center.
Focus on developing your pieces efficiently to gain control of the board.
Consider king safety before launching a premature attack.
Review the Caro-Kann Defense to understand typical plans and tactics.
